premises: The machine will start or the system will fail but not both at the same time
conclusions: If the system does not fail, then the machine will start
incorrect conclusions: If the machine will start, then the system will fail
If the system will fail, then the machine will start

premises: The circuit will close or the alarm will trigger but not both at the same time
conclusions: If the alarm does not trigger, then the circuit will close
incorrect conclusions: If the circuit will close, then the alarm will trigger
If the alarm will trigger, then the circuit will close

premises: The engine will overheat or the coolant system will engage but not both at the same time
conclusions: If the coolant system does not engage, then the engine will overheat
incorrect conclusions: The coolant system will not engage
If the engine will overheat, then the coolant system will engage
If the coolant system will engage, then the engine will overheat
